intro: Cupania belizensis, commonly known as the Belize cupania, is a flowering plant native to Central America, particularly Belize. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to several meters. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
